headline: Steel and Aluminum Stocks Fall, Automakers Gain After Reports of Tariff Pullback
summary: Shares in U.S. steel and aluminum producers fell after reports that the Trump administration is considering whether to narrow the scope of import taxes on the metals.  Steelmakers Nucor, Steel Dynamics and Cleveland-Cliffs all declined 3% or more Friday, following the reports by the Financial Times and Bloomberg, before clawing back some losses.  Century Aluminum skidded 8.5%.

headline: Shares in Steel and Aluminum Companies Fall After Reports of Tariff Pullback
summary: Shares in U.S. steel and aluminum producers fell after reports that the Trump administration is considering whether to narrow the scope of import taxes on the metals.  Steelmakers Nucor, Steel Dynamics and Cleveland-Cliffs all declined 5% or more Friday, following the reports by the Financial Times and Bloomberg, before clawing back some losses.  Century Aluminum at one point skidded more than 11% lower.

raw.headline: Shares in Steel and Aluminum Companies Fall After Reports of Tariff Pullback
raw.summary: Shares in U.S. steel and aluminum producers fell after reports that the Trump administration is considering whether to narrow the scope of import taxes on the metals.  Steelmakers Nucor, Steel Dynamics and Cleveland-Cliffs all declined 5% or more Friday, following the reports by the Financial Times and Bloomberg, before clawing back some losses.  Century Aluminum at one point skidded more than 11% lower.

headline: Trump Could Lower Steel Tariffs. It’s Hitting These Stocks.
summary: Steel stocks were lower early Friday, hit by fears that President Donald Trump’s tariffs, which support higher commodity prices, could be rolled back.  Shares of domestic steel makers  Cleveland-Cliffs Steel Dynamics  and  Nucor  were down 2.5%, 5%, and 3.6%, respectively, while  and  futures were both down about 0.3%.  The White House didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.
